articles.description: Build-up to Wednesday's Champions League games, plus Liverpool, West Ham, Brighton and Rangers Europa League news conferences.

articles.description: Most of the Spain team agree to end their boycott, says secretary of state for sports Victor Francos.
articles.title: Spain players agree to end boycott

articles.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer criticises the behaviour of some players during his time as Manchester United manager, saying they were not as good as they thought they were.
articles.title: Solskjaer criticises some players from Man Utd reign

articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says club "in trouble" with a mounting injury list that threatens to disrupt his side's perfect start to the season.
articles.title: Man City 'in trouble' with injuries - Guardiola

articles.description: Scotland's Gemma Dryburgh says she has no fear about her Solheim Cup debut because she "knows she is just as good" as the USA team stars.
articles.title: 'I'm as good as US stars' - Solheim rookie Dryburgh

articles.description: This Seattle Mariner leapfrogged Oakland Athletics towards their 7-2 win.

articles.description: The world's top two teams collide and Wales face a crunch game with Australia - what to watch in week three of the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: What to look out for in week three at Rugby World Cup

articles.description: In his BBC Sport column, Anthony Yarde reflects on moving forward after defeat and how Joe Joyce can get revenge over Zhilei Zhang.
articles.title: A defeat is only a loss when you give up - Yarde
